result.execSummary:
The defendant Denzel B Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession With Intent To Deliver Controlled Substance-Cocaine (>5-15 Grams), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No new law violations.
No contact with firearms.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments.  To be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Possession With Intent To Deliver Controlled Substance-Cocaine (>5-15 Grams)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denzel B Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Denzel B Jackson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Denzel B Jackson.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf and Jon Josephsen appeared in court on behalf of Patrick T. Franken  for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. 

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint / Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 years, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 62 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, with random urine screens.
- Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
- Thinking for a Change course.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
- No new law violations. 
-  50 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide DNA Sample.
- Defendant is NOT ELIGIBLE for expungement.

*Court finds defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Email correspondence with parties. Case scheduled for a plea hearing on 10/12/2022 at 09:00 am, Br 16.
Received and Filed: Waiver of Prompt Disposition

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Denzel B Jackson not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and offer.  Defense informs the court of prompt disposition request.  Court requests a signed copy by defendant.  Court scheduled a status conference to be held via Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Request for Prompt Disposition

Defendant Denzel B Jackson in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Denzel B Jackson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Denzel B Jackson in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Denzel B Jackson in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Denzel B Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
